info.title: Returns Management
info.description: Returns can be initiated from Walmart.com, even for items purchased from marketplace sellers (Except for HAZMAT or FREIGHT items).

post.description: Refunds one or more order lines that have been shipped. The response to a successful call contains the order with the refunded line item

get.description: Retrieves the details of all return orders for the specified filter criteria. The same API can be used to search a single order based on returnOrderId/ customerOrderId This API supports only upto an offset of 1000 in response with max limit 100 orders. If you want to fetch more than 1000 then you can use the cursor API.

parameters.name: returnCreationStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all return orders after that date. Either both the returnCreationStartDate, returnCreationEndDate must be present in the query params or none present. Use URI encoded time format.

parameters.name: returnCreationEndDate
parameters.description: End Date for querying all return orders after that date. Either both the returnCreationStartDate, returnCreationEndDate must be present in the query params or none present. Use URI encoded time format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be greater than 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting offset of the first order required in the response. Cannot be greater than 1000

parameters.name: statusCodeFilter
parameters.description: The status code filter to apply. Valid values will be Initiated, Completed and Cancelled.

parameters.name: isWFSEnabled
parameters.description: Flag to get WFS returns. Valid value is Y

get.summary: Get all returns with cursor mark
get.description: Retrieves the details of all return orders for the specified filter criteria. With this API you can get all orders in response, it returns nextCursorMark for the next 100 orders so on and so forth upto the last order. The same API can be used to search a single order based on returnOrderId/ customerOrderId.

parameters.name: returnCreationStartDate
parameters.description: Start Date for querying all return orders after that date. Either both the returnCreationStartDate, returnCreationEndDate must be present in the query params or none present. If passed must be in the format - 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX' (Ex. 2022-01-29T10:53:12.355-09:30 ). Use URI encoded time format.

parameters.name: returnCreationEndDate
parameters.description: End Date for querying all return orders after that date. Either both the returnCreationStartDate, returnCreationEndDate must be present in the query params or none present. If passed must be in the format - 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX' (Ex. 2022-01-29T10:53:12.355-09:30 ). Use URI encoded time format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be greater than 100.

parameters.name: cursorMark
parameters.description: The cursor from which next set of records to be retrieved.

parameters.name: statusCodeFilter
parameters.description: The status code filter to apply. Valid values will be Initiated, Completed and Cancelled.

parameters.name: isWFSEnabled
parameters.description: Flag to get WFS returns. Valid value is Y

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

Charge.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

ChargeAmount.description: The details about the charges for the line item

name.description: Charge Names: lineUnitPrice, lineProductTaxes, lineTotalTaxes, lineRestockingFee, lineShippingFee, lineSubTotal, lineTotal.

ChargeTotal.description: Contains name value pairs of calculated charges for the line. Eg: if order line has 3 Qty, this will have a shipping charge = 3 * shipping charge per unit (This is present in the line level charges).

returnOrders.description: List of returns for the seller.

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters hyphen (-), space ( ), and period (.) are not allowed.

Item.description: Details of the item to be returned

unitOfMeasurement.description: The unit with which the orderLine is measured

amount.description: The amount with witch the orderLine is measured along with unitofMeasurement

Measurement.description: The quantity associated with the shipment line

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

Money.description: Price of One unit of item, in this order line

unitOfMeasurement.description: The unit of measure in the item's weight (e.g., 'POUND' or 'OUNCE')

amount.description: The quantity of the unit of measure for the item

Quantity.description: Total quantity returned in this return line

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

returnOrderId.description: Return order identifier of the return order. This is the same as RMA number.

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

returnOrderLines.description: A list of order lines in the return order

ReturnOrder.description: List of returns for the seller.

returnOrderLineNumber.description: The returns order line number for that return

primeLineNumber.description: The purchase order line number for the return created

returnReason.description: Gives the reason that was selected during the return creation.
enum: Error de características en el sitio
Excepción de entrega/ No se pudo entregar
Modelo surtido no corresponde al comprado
Problema al aplicar cupón o promocion
Robo o extravío de mercancía en tienda

reasonCode.description: Gives the return reason code associated with returnReason

purchaseOrderId.description: The purchase order ID for the return created

purchaseOrderLineNumber.description: The purchase order line number for the return created

charges.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

chargeTotals.description: Contains name value pairs of calculated charges for the line. Eg: if order line has 3 Qty, this will have a shipping charge = 3 * shipping charge per unit (This is present in the line level charges).

isWFSEnabled.description: Determines Walmart Fulfilled vs Seller Fulfilled returns. Valid values are: Y, N

ReturnOrderLine.description: A list of order lines in the return order

primeLineNo.description: The number to identify the associated order line for the shipment line. Example: 'primeLineNo=1 means the shipment line is associated with orderLine having primeLineNumber=1'

shipmentLineNo.description: The unique number for the shipment line in a given shipment

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. It can be upto two decimal points.

returnOrders.description: List of returns for the seller.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

accessTokenScheme.description: Header authentication with a Walmart access token, which is automatically generated using your Client ID and Client Secret. The token is valid for 15 minutes, and will be passed in the WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN header

basicScheme.description: Basic authentication with a Walmart Client ID and Client Secret
